channel.title: Does OSRS GWD influence the current situation of OSRS players'population?
channel.description:
Since January, 2013, the population of osrs players has been counted and the statistics show that the old school runescpe has lost almost 50% of its population in 3 months. And many people presume that the old school runescape will die soon. However, to relieve the severe situation and make the game live longer, its developer fully takes players’ needs into first consideration and works hard by bringing back the popular God Wars Dungeon. Will this God Wars Dungeon increase population for old school runescape?
The average runescape 2007 users between October 5th and October 12th are fluctuated around 10,000. At 09:25:02 on October 12nd, 2013, there are 7,787 old school runescape players totally. From the above statistics, we cann’t be so optimistic about the future of old school runescape. We have no idea what will happen after Oct. 17th, 2013 – the release day of osrs God Wars Dungeon. （ARTICLE SOURCE:http://www.rsorder.com/profile/news/read/id/791）
Your view for this？

item.title: Does OSRS GWD influence the current situation of OSRS players'population?
item.dc:creator: @CoderOops CoderOops
item.description:
@CoderOops wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:15, topic:534627”][quote author=CoderOops link=topic=653427.msg4379664#msg4379664 date=1383142176]

That shitty combat system and the ugly item looks killed the game.

OSR,they should have choose a better version.

and what does the mr suggest?
[/quote]
The game wasn’t actually ruined until the armor visual update and SOF, that was what started the games fall[/quote]
It looks like that we are currently going for time before Sof… and even better!
End of this month they will bring out new slayer stuff and roof agility etc.
I think it is right way.

Read full topic
item.source: Does OSRS GWD influence the current situation of OSRS players'population?

item.title: Does OSRS GWD influence the current situation of OSRS players'population?
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

Had they actually worked to implement the very successful updates from later years into the game and assisted in removing bots quicker and didn’t make it 8 bucks, it would be way more popular. Let’s face it, the fact that players have to pay 8 dollars USD to play an already created game with very few good updates just made it not worth it. You could play a decent meh RSPS for free and have more fun.

Read full topic
item.source: Does OSRS GWD influence the current situation of OSRS players'population?

item.title: Does OSRS GWD influence the current situation of OSRS players'population?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

the elve age:

SOF was like a year ago. You started hating RS around the times claws were introduced. Maybe a little later, but you constantly were posting on threads telling us how much you hated Runescape and how you wished the good old days were back. Am I hitting the right spot here or a little misled?

Doesn’t make much sense, the only reasons I hate modern runescape are Solomons, SOF, the armor look, and EOC. I did start to get a bit mad when the loyalty program was introduced, because I knew where the game was headed. In fact, I was going to renew my membership the day before Solomons was released. I got over SOF and hoped that was the last RWT type thing Jagex would add. The day I went to the homepage to sign up I saw the Solomons news post.

Read full topic
item.source: Does OSRS GWD influence the current situation of OSRS players'population?

item.title: Does OSRS GWD influence the current situation of OSRS players'population?
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:17, topic:534627”][quote author=the elve age link=topic=653427.msg4380198#msg4380198 date=1383263181]

if they didn’t trash the main game id feel happier playing. Better graphics yet its still good ol runescape

I’m not going to re-grind OSRS when its pretty much discontinued. Most old RS players aren’t that young anymore and can’t come home from school and play for 12 hours a day. We have jobs now/college

Then dont play it, stick to EoC. They aren’t forcing anybody to play it. It’s for those who truly loved the OSRS

I truly loved old RS, But I’m saying I would have played happily on any version before the armor graphics update/EOC
[/quote]I’m calling BS on this one. You’ve been trashing Runescape for the past 2-3 years.

… which was when SOF and the armor update were introduced. Solomons was icing on the cake to me quitting, EOC I wasn’t active during.[/quote]SOF was like a year ago. You started hating RS around the times claws were introduced. Maybe a little later, but you constantly were posting on threads telling us how much you hated Runescape and how you wished the good old days were back. Am I hitting the right spot here or a little misled?

Read full topic
item.source: Does OSRS GWD influence the current situation of OSRS players'population?

item.title: Does OSRS GWD influence the current situation of OSRS players'population?
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:10, topic:534627”][quote author=Stunninhigh link=topic=653427.msg4378530#msg4378530 date=1382799714]

if they didn’t trash the main game id feel happier playing. Better graphics yet its still good ol runescape

I’m not going to re-grind OSRS when its pretty much discontinued. Most old RS players aren’t that young anymore and can’t come home from school and play for 12 hours a day. We have jobs now/college

Then dont play it, stick to EoC. They aren’t forcing anybody to play it. It’s for those who truly loved the OSRS
[/quote]
I truly loved old RS, But I’m saying I would have played happily on any version before the armor graphics update/EOC[/quote]I’m calling BS on this one. You’ve been trashing Runescape for the past 2-3 years.

On topic though. Like Spades mentioned, if they brought back all of our stuff and stats, the game would’ve been much more successful and enjoyable. It would’ve brought back even more veterans, and I would’ve continued to progress my account I worked so hard for. Not to mention, the economy wouldn’t have turned to absolute shit within 3 weeks.

Read full topic

item.title: Does OSRS GWD influence the current situation of OSRS players'population?
item.dc:creator: @CoderOops CoderOops
item.description:
@CoderOops wrote:

Well new players dont want to join because it is mostly race between players who started early.

Also oldschool rs is just tiny link on official website so people hardly see it.

AND rs always been famous for free-player base (kept economy healthy back then, when oldschool was live.)
Now only reason for lobsters are slayer.

Read full topic

item.title: Does OSRS GWD influence the current situation of OSRS players'population?
item.dc:creator: @Stunninhigh Stunninhigh
item.description:
@Stunninhigh wrote:

Spades:

I probably would have played their 2007 servers, I didn’t want to start all over again. If they would have even started us off at what our stats were at the time I would have been ok with that. I wasn’t ok with starting all over.

What do you expect? For everything to be handed to you? That would have been unfair to give everybody those stats they had in EoC. That was the point of 2007 servers, to restart and play from how it felt in 2007. If they gave you your stats back, You wouldnt have the feel of being able to train, and start from scratch.

Read full topic
item.source: Does OSRS GWD influence the current situation of OSRS players'population?

item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

Stealmojo:

Literally logged into EoC, to check it out… Killed a few cows and couldn’t figure out how to change anything.

RS3 now. But, it’s like when you start to play a new game, you have to get used to the interfaces, controls, etc… Once you do, it becomes a lot easier and isn’t complicated.

item.title: Does OSRS GWD influence the current situation of OSRS players'population?
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

Jagex could have had a large influx of new/returning players imo had they set at least one world to f2p.

When GWD was released, it was #3 on twitch views. Had they allowed players from other games to try it, or former players they could have gotten a small rise in players.

But the future is bleak. Look at RSC servers(jagex hosted). When I play them worlds are always less than 30 players. Same thing will happen in years to come.

Read full topic
item.source: Does OSRS GWD influence the current situation of OSRS players'population?

item.title: Does OSRS GWD influence the current situation of OSRS players'population?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

There won’t be any new players to the game. Whether or not established players are lured in one last time is another matter.
Basically the game is past its use-by date; it’s too late for someone new to sign up and achieve high enough levels to enjoy the new feature.

Read full topic
item.source: Does OSRS GWD influence the current situation of OSRS players'population?
